data.title: Your next election
data.meta_description: Local election to be held on 7 May 2026. Your next election. View dates and details about upcoming elections.
data.text:
The next local election is scheduled for Thursday, 7 May 2026.

The last local election was held on Thursday, 2 May 2024.

People who run your council are called councillors. They make important decisions, such as how the council budget is spent and which services are prioritised.

Each councillor is elected for a 4-year term of office and there are 3 councillors representing each council ward in the borough. Councillors are elected every year, over a 4-year cycle (with no elections in the fourth year). This means at each election a third of councillors are elected. Upcoming election years are 2026, 2027, 2028, 2030 and on a continued cycle.

Following an electoral boundary review, all 60 councillor seats were contested at the local election in 2022. This meant that electors were able to vote for up to 3 candidates in their ward instead of just one.

At a local election, people will vote to choose who they would like to be their local councillor. The political party with the highest number of councillors usually controls the council and decides how local services are run. Your local councillor will represent your views for the ward (area) you live in.

Election notices

Once election notices are available for the next election we will add these to this section.

Key deadlines

Once key dates are available for the next election we will add these to this section.

Local government election timetable for Thursday, 7 May 2026. Service area Date Publication of notice of election To be published when available. Receipt of nominations To be published when available. Withdrawal of candidates To be published when available. Appointment of election agents To be published when available. Publication of notice of election agents To be published when available. Publication of statements of persons nominated To be published when available. Last date to register to vote To be published when available. Receipt of postal vote applications To be published when available. Last day for voter authority certificates To be published when available. Publication of notice of poll To be published when available. Receipt of proxy vote applications To be published when available. First day to issue replacement lost postal ballot papers To be published when available. Last day to issue replacement spoilt or lost postal ballot papers To be published when available. Receipt of emergency proxy vote applications To be published when available. Day of poll 7am-10pm on Thursday, 7 May 2026

More about the next election
